page.title: 19NOTTSWOOD HILL
page.content: {Nottswood Hill}is the hamlet at the extreme eastern end of our area. It consists of only 6 houses and so the population is very small. We decided to include it in the text because the people here still enjoy commoners' rights.This is one of the few areas in Gloucestershire which still possesses these rights.{Walnut Tree Cottage} which dates from 1678 is of wattle and daub construction. In the past the cottages must have been built by squatters. It is interesting to note that the hamlet was not enclosed in the 18th century, probably because it was mainly used for sheep-farming and not under arable cultivation.
